questions.question_text: Which three CLI commands can you use to troubleshoot Layer 3 issues, if the issue is in neither the physical layer nor the link layer? (Choose three.)

An administrator wants to configure dead peer detection (DPD) on IPsec VPN for detecting dead tunnels. The requirement is that FortiGate sends DPD probes only when there is outbound traffic but no response from the peer.

Which DPD mode on FortiGate meets this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The requirement is that FortiGate sends DPD probes only when there is outbound traffic but no response from the peer = when FortiGate Demand / On Demand

Selected Answer: A
A. On Demand
answer : A

A is correct.
On Demand = Probing when there's outbound traffic but no response
On Idle = Probing when there's no interesting traffic at all
A is correct

choices.C: FortiGate continues to run critical security actions, such as quarantine.
choices.A: FortiGate halts complete system operation and requires a reboot to regain available resources
choices.D: FortiGate continues to transmit packets without IPS inspection when the fail-open global setting in IPS is enabled
choices.B: FortiGate refuses to accept configuration changes

questions.question_text: Which two statements are correct when FortiGate enters conserve mode? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: B & D is correct, refer to FortiGate 7.4 Study Guide p. 460. It does not accept config changes, because it might increase memory usage even further. It explicitly does NOT run any quarantine actions. You can configure IPS fail-open to control how IPS behaves when the IPS socket buffer is full.

Selected Answer: BD
B & D

Selected Answer: BD
A. FortiGate halts complete system operation and requires a reboot to regain available resources [WRONG]
It prevents to overload the firewall.

B. FortiGate refuses to accept configuration changes [CORRECT]
"FortiGate does not accept configuration changes, because they might increase memory usage."

C. FortiGate continues to run critical security actions, such as quarantine. [WRONG]
"FortiGate does not run any quarantine action, including forwarding suspicious files to FortiSandbox."

D. FortiGate continues to transmit packets without IPS inspection when the fail-open global setting in IPS is enabled [CORRECT]
"You can configure the fail-open setting under config ips global to control how the IPS engine behaves when the IPS socket buffer is full."

Referece: FortiGate 7.4 Administrator Study Guide, page 460

Selected Answer: BD
Should be B&D
I will say B&C
B D correct
B is for sure good, I think D too

questions.question_text: Which statement is correct regarding the use of application control for inspecting web applications?

choices.D: Application control does not require SSL Inspection to Identify web applications
choices.C: Application control does not display a replacement message for a blocked web application
choices.B: Application control signatures are included in Fortinet Antivirus engine
choices.A: Application control can identify child and parent applications, and perform different actions on them

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Application control can identify child and parent applications, and perform different actions on them
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A correct
A correct
ACE Correct

Answers are A,C,E 
FCP FGT Administrator Study Guide Page No 248-363

Selected Answer: ACE
FortiGate must check that the preferred member has a valid route to the destination
SD-WAN Rules only apply if the traffic goes throught SD-WAN

Selected Answer: ACE
SD-WAN rules are matched only if the best route to the destination points to SD-WAN
SD-WAN member is selected only if it has a route to the destination
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/7.0.0/sd-wan-sd-branch-architecture-for-mssps/768108/sd-wan-routing-logic

SDWAN rules are 'policy routes', but regular policy routes have precedence over SD-WAN rules.
https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Tip-Explaining-the-SD-WAN-rule-matching-process/ta-p/284325

Selected Answer: ACE
A&C&E correct

Selected Answer: ACE
FGT 7.4 ASG

Selected Answer: ACE
FGT 7.4 ASG

Selected Answer: ACE
ACE I think

A. By default, SD-WAN members are skipped if they do not have a valid route to the destination. 
C. By default, SD-WAN rules are skipped if the best route to the destination is not an SD-WAN member. 
E. Regular policy routes have precedence over SD-WAN rules

questions.question_text: What are three key routing principles in SD-WAN? (Choose three.)

choices.B: By default, SD-WAN rules are skipped if only one route to the destination is available
choices.E: Regular policy routes have precedence over SD-WAN rules
choices.C: By default, SD-WAN rules are skipped if the best route to the destination is not an SD-WAN member
choices.D: SD-WAN rules have precedence over any other type of routes
choices.A: By default, SD-WAN members are skipped if they do not have a valid route to the destination
